2022-02-19.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2022-02-19.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2022-02-19.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-02-19.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-02-19.name: Polar Fest
2022-02-19.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2022-02-19.name: Winterfest
2022-02-19.summary: In this St. Croix River town, there will be a parka pub crawl, ice maze, stein-holding and beard contests, axe-throwing, ice carving and Saturday parade and fireworks.

2022-02-19.name: Winter Jubilee
2022-02-19.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with smoosh racing, competitions in snow sculpting, nail driving, ice fishing and wood splitting, and a Saturday parade.

2022-02-19.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-19.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features bed races, ice-carving, a dog weight  pull competition, an egg hunt for kids and a parade at 1 p.m. Saturday.

2022-02-19.name: Free Weekend in Michigan state parks
2022-02-19.summary: There's no vehicle-entry fee in Michigan state parks this weekend, and Saturday and Sunday also is Free Fishing Weekend.

2022-02-19.name: Fire & Ice
2022-02-19.summary: Ice and snow sculptors create pieces around town. There's a novice category for beginners. On Friday, there will be a candlelight ski/hike at Big Creek Nature Preserve, and on Saturday, there will be fireworks.

2022-02-19.name: Big Turn Music Fest
2022-02-19.summary: At the Sheldon Theatre in downtown Red Wing, six bands are playing:Â  Brothers Burn Mountain, Low, Cloud Cult, Heiruspecs, Annie Mack and Bad Bad Hat.

2022-02-19.name: Book Across the Bay
2022-02-19.summary: The weekend starts with a Friday-night party in Ashland. On Saturday night, ski or snowshoe across Lake Superior's Chequamegon Bay on a 10-kilometer route lined by ice luminaries. If you're not too fast, fireworks will fill the sky as you're approaching Washburn; a bonfire, chili feed and blues music follow.

2022-02-19.name: Color the Wind Kite Festival
2022-02-19.summary: This town in north-central Iowa draws kiters from eight states for its festival, the largest in the Midwest, and stunt fliers will perform routines choreographed to music.

2022-02-19.name: Barstool Races
2022-02-19.summary: In this small town north of Cable, watch people careen down a hill on decorated bar stools, then stay for the chili feed.

2022-02-19.name: Northwoods Blizzard Blast
2022-02-19.summary: On the snowy northeast edge of Wisconsin, go on horse-drawn sleigh rides and see such events as recliner racing, ice bowling, dog-sled dashing, snowshoe baseball and snow sculpting.

2022-02-04.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-02-04.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-02-04.name: Winter Carnival
2022-02-04.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2022-02-04.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-04.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2022-02-04.name: Winterfest and U.S. Snow Sculpting Championship
2022-02-04.summary: In this lake town, there's music, magic shows, a human sled-dog race, a cocoa crawl, ice bars and an ice castle, plus the U.S. snow-sculpting championship.

2022-02-04.name: Hot Air Affair
2022-02-04.summary: There will be balloon rides, moon glows and such events as geocaching, bird-watching, a fat-tire bike race and a corn-hole tournament.

2022-02-04.name: Ice Breaker
2022-02-04.summary: There's an ice-carving competition in this Lake Michigan town, plus a chili cook-off. curling lessons, frozen-fish fling,cardboard-sled race and disc golf tournament.

2022-02-04.name: Magical Ice Fest
2022-02-04.summary: Watch the pros carve sculptures in this Lake Michigan town. There's also entertainment, a scavenger hunt and magic and crafts for kids.

2022-02-04.name: Iola Winter Carnival
2022-02-04.summary: This village near Waupaca offers ice carving, ski jumping and ski, snowshoe and fat-bike races.

2022-02-04.name: Winter Dance Party
2022-02-04.summary: The Surf Ballroom marks the 61st anniversary of the plane crash that killed Buddy Holly, with concerts, luncheons, dance lessons and crash-site tours.

2022-02-04.name: WinterFest
2022-02-04.summary: In this Brainerd Lakes area town, there are horse-drawn sleigh rides, bonfires, soup sampling, ice car races, Friday fireworks and Italian Outdoor Olympics.

2022-02-04.name: SocialICE
2022-02-04.summary: At Peace Plaza downtown, five ice bars each offer a different theme and signature drink, with ice sculptures illuminated by lights and nightly DJ entertainment. On Saturday afternoon, there's a FAM JAM for families.

2022-02-04.name: Knickerbocker Ice Festival
2022-02-04.summary: The festival in this town east of Madison includes such events as a fish toss, snowball-eating contest, dad-sled race, chili cook-off and Iceberg Open golf tournament. There's ice carving and ice wine, too.

2022-02-04.name: Banbury Art Crawl
2022-02-04.summary: Visit more than 100 artists at studios in the Building 13 art complex. Many will give demonstrations. There will be also music, food and art projects for children.

2022-02-05.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-02-05.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-02-05.name: Art Shanty Projects
2022-02-05.summary: Frozen Lake Harriet hosts two dozen artist-designed ice houses and lots of fun art antics for kids and adults alike. Check for scheduled events and ice conditions.

2022-02-05.name: Winter Carnival
2022-02-05.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2022-02-05.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-05.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2022-02-05.summary: In this lake town, there's music, magic shows, a human sled-dog race, a cocoa crawl, ice bars and an ice castle, plus the U.S. snow-sculpting championship.

2022-02-05.summary: There will be balloon rides, moon glows and such events as geocaching, bird-watching, a fat-tire bike race and a corn-hole tournament.

2022-02-05.name: Magical Ice Fest
2022-02-05.summary: Watch the pros carve sculptures in this Lake Michigan town. There's also entertainment, a scavenger hunt and magic and crafts for kids.

2022-02-05.name: Iola Winter Carnival
2022-02-05.summary: This village near Waupaca offers ice carving, ski jumping and ski, snowshoe and fat-bike races.

2022-02-05.name: Pine Mountain Ski Jumping Tournament
2022-02-05.summary: The tournament in this Upper Peninsula town on the Wisconsin border is where the             international jumpers compete; it's a stop on the Continental Cup circuit.

2022-02-05.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-05.summary: This Door County village lets loose with such events as a  toilet-seat throw, pie tin toss, bean-bag cannon shoot, smoosh racing and an  ugly-sweater contest. There are also free trolley rides, ice carving, a fiddle contest, a snowshoe dance and  fireworks.

2022-02-05.name: City of Lakes Loppet
2022-02-05.summary: For recreational skiers, the highlight of this big cross-country ski festival is the Saturday-night Luminary Loppet on Lake of the Isles, with glowing ice pillars and "ruins.'' Reserve a time slot in advance.

2022-02-05.name: Winter Dance Party
2022-02-05.summary: The Surf Ballroom marks the 61st anniversary of the plane crash that killed Buddy Holly, with concerts, luncheons, dance lessons and crash-site tours.

2022-02-05.name: WinterFest
2022-02-05.summary: In this Brainerd Lakes area town, there are horse-drawn sleigh rides, bonfires, soup sampling, ice car races, Friday fireworks and Italian Outdoor Olympics.

2022-02-05.summary: The festival in this town east of Madison includes such events as a fish toss, snowball-eating contest, dad-sled race, chili cook-off and Iceberg Open golf tournament. There's ice carving and ice wine, too.

2022-02-05.name: Banbury Art Crawl
2022-02-05.summary: Visit more than 100 artists at studios in the Building 13 art complex. Many will give demonstrations. There will be also music, food and art projects for children.

2022-02-05.name: Cold Front
2022-02-05.summary: This port town on Lake Superior celebrates winter with a festival in Bayfront Festival Park that includes dog sledding, ice skating, bonfires, food and drink.

2022-02-10.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-02-10.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-10.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2022-02-10.name: Frozen River Film Festival
2022-02-10.summary: This festival shows a large selection of documentaries specializing in adventure, extreme sports and environmental issues.

2022-02-10.name: Winter Carnival
2022-02-10.summary: This snow fest at Michigan Tech University includes a human dog-sled race, snow volleyball and a tug of war and ends with a torchlight parade and fireworks at Mont Ripley ski hill.

2022-02-10.name: Michigan Ice Fest
2022-02-10.summary: Watch ice-climbing demos, slide shows and professional climbers and take clinics for beginners at spectacular Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore on Lake Superior.

2022-02-11.name: Celebration of the Lakes
2022-02-11.summary: This festival north of the Twin Cities includes snowmobile races, fat biking, an ice-fishing tournament, sled-dog rides and a free ice-fishing clinic for kids.

2022-02-11.name: Scandihoovian Winter Festival
2022-02-11.summary: The festival in this town just west of Madison features such events as turkey bowling, a snowman-building contest, kick sledding, a spelling bee and a vintage snowmobile show and ride.

2022-02-11.name: Sturgeon Spectacular
2022-02-11.summary: Lake Winnebago is the setting for this celebration of giant fish. There will be ice carving and snow sculpting, a snowman-building contest, bonfires and live music.

2022-02-12.name: Ice Lantern Festival
2022-02-12.summary: See ice lanterns created by artists and students in this arty southwest Wisconsin town and visit the cupcake/cookie/hot chocolate bar as well as the ice bar.

2022-02-12.name: Kites on Ice Festival
2022-02-12.summary: This festival on Buffalo Lake and in Sturges Park, just northwest of Minneapolis, features show-kite flyers, free kites for kids, a beer garden, dog-sled rides and a cornhole tournament.

2022-02-18.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike

2022-02-26.name: American Birkebeiner
2022-02-26.summary: The "Greatest Show on Snow'' includes races of all distances for all ages and abilities plus skijoring and vintage ski.

2022-02-26.name: Bockfest at Capital Brewery
2022-02-26.summary: This Madison-area brewery celebrates with the Running of the Blondes 1K race, a fish toss, music, costumes and, of course, beer. Tickets go on sale Dec. 1 and sell out fast.Â

2022-02-26.name: Blue Ribbon Bacon Festival
2022-02-26.summary: It's all about bacon at this festival at the Horizon Event Center. The theme is Bacon Gras, with Cajun-infused bacon dishes and street performers and beads on Bacon Bourbon Street. There's also live music, a silent disco, cooking demos and a bacon-eating contest.

2022-02-26.name: Trenary Outhouse Classic
2022-02-26.summary: In this little town, not far from Munising and Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, there will be potty-pushing contests for kids and adults, a best fur-hat contest and lots of craft beer.

2022-02-26.name: Leech Lake Frostfest
2022-02-26.summary: This town on Leech Lake offers fat-bike demos, dog-sled rides, a snow-golf course, lumberjack races, children's games and craft beer.

2022-02-26.name: Chili Ice Walk
2022-02-26.summary: Between noon and 4 p.m., walk downtown to see ice sculpting, sample chili from eight restaurants and go on a scavenger hunt in shop windows.

2022-02-01.name: Groundhog Days
2022-02-01.summary: The 1993 movie "Groundhog Day'' was filmed in this town an hour northwest of Chicago, and it celebrates with trivia, a bags tourney, bingo and walking tours of movie sites, including the 1889 Opera House, where actor Bill Murray jumped from the belfry. At 7 a.m. Wednesday, Woodstock Willie will look for his shadow.

2022-02-20.name: Free Weekend in Michigan state parks
2022-02-20.summary: There's no vehicle-entry fee in Michigan state parks this weekend, and Saturday and Sunday also is Free Fishing Weekend.

2022-02-21.name: Polar Fest
2022-02-21.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2022-02-21.name: Winterfest
2022-02-21.summary: In this St. Croix River town, there will be a parka pub crawl, ice maze, stein-holding and beard contests, axe-throwing, ice carving and Saturday parade and fireworks.

2022-02-22.name: Polar Fest
2022-02-22.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2022-02-23.name: American Birkebeiner
2022-02-23.summary: The "Greatest Show on Snow'' includes races of all distances for all ages and abilities plus skijoring and vintage ski.

2022-02-07.name: Winter Festival
2022-02-07.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2022-02-07.name: Frozen River Film Festival
2022-02-07.summary: This festival shows a large selection of documentaries specializing in adventure, extreme sports and environmental issues.

2022-02-09.name: Winter Carnival
2022-02-09.summary: This snow fest at Michigan Tech University includes a human dog-sled race, snow volleyball and a tug of war and ends with a torchlight parade and fireworks at Mont Ripley ski hill.

2022-02-09.name: Michigan Ice Fest
2022-02-09.summary: Watch ice-climbing demos, slide shows and professional climbers and take clinics for beginners at spectacular Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore on Lake Superior.
